tooltip.pishock-zap.config.general.vibra: Only vibrate the device, don't shock, even on death
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.general.shock:
Shock the user on death with a
configurable intensity and duration.
If disabled, normal damage shocks will still occur.

Shock the user with an intensity
based on remaining health instead of damage.
This may encourage the user to stay healed up.

tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.max_du:
The maximum duration of the shock/vibration

tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.vibrat:
The damage threshold below which the device
will vibrate instead of shocking
This is in half-hearts, so 1 is half a heart,
2 is a heart, etc.
Set to 0 to disable vibration.

The minimum intensity of the vibration
on damage

The maximum intensity of the vibration
on damage (when just at threshold)

The intensity of shocks on death

tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.debo:
The minimum time between shocks/vibrations,
in seconds
For practical reasons, this is limited to 1 second.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.accu:
Accumulate the duration of shocks/vibrations
If this is enabled, when debouncing, the duration of
the shocks/vibrations that could not be sent
will be added to the next shock/vibration.

Accumulate the intensity of shocks/vibrations
If this is enabled, when debouncing, the intensity of
the shocks/vibrations that could not be sent
will be added to the next shock/vibration.
Limits are of course still respected.
This is similar to the effect of taking the damage all at once.
If this is disabled, the intensity of the resulting shock/vibration
will be the greatest of the queued shocks/vibrations.
Disabling it is easier on the user :)
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.queu:
Queue differently-sized shocks/vibrations separately
If this is enabled, when debouncing, differently-sized
shocks/vibrations will not accumulate duration with each other,
and will instead be sent separately.
Incompatible with intensity accumulation.
